original_title: Sri Lanka plans to make railways into authority: Minister
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka Railways which is now a government department will be turned into an authority to allowing it to be run like commercially oriented agency, Transport Minister Bandula Gunawardana said.
Railways is making large losses and cannot make decisions fast.
There was no decision to privatize the railways but there will be public private partnerships for services.
Then Ports Minister Lalith Athulathmudali had made the ports into an authority, allowing it to make commercial decisions. The Colombo Port Commission was a department set up by the British.
The railways also a government department which was built by the British.
Departments also pay pensions unlike statutory authorities and boards. (Colombo/June13/2023)
